```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
M <- 1.898e27
P <- (9*60 + 55) * 60
G <- 6.674e-11
ans <- (G * M * P^2 / 4 / pi^2) ^ (1 / 3) / 1000 # km

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\times 10^3$ km", signif(sc$questions / 1000, 3))
```
Question
========
What is the radius of the geosynchronous orbit around Jupiter? The mass of Jupiter
is $1.898 \times 10^{27}$ kg. A "day" on Jupiter lasts $9$ hours and $55$ minutes.

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
The radius of a circular geosynchronous orbit is given by
$$r = \sqrt[3]{\frac{GMT^2}{4 \pi^2}} = `r format(signif(ans,3), scientific = FALSE)` \text{ km}$$
